item.title: Linux TCP Socket States, the Listen Backlog and SYN cookies
item.description: For a TLDR about the Listen Backlog and SYN cookies: Jump to the Listen Backlog and SYN cookies explanation Whether you want to investigate a half-opened/half-closed connection issue in Linux or you want to know if your application leaks sockets, then this command might be helpful: $ lsof -a -i TCP:5000 -p 3921 | tail -n +2 | awk 'BEGIN{listen=0;estab=0;other=0} /ESTABLISHED/{estab+=1} /LISTEN/{listen+=1} !/ESTABLISHED|LISTEN/{other+=1; print} END{printf("established=%s listen=%s other=%s\n", estab, listen, other)}' That command is pretty long, so from left to right we’re piping the output of lsof into tail, then awk.
